title: Cognitive Map-Based Leadership Course for Online Learning Design and Implementation

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Designed for corporate training managers/leaders, conducted in an offline group learning environment utilizing digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can identify at least three cognitive factors (motivation, usefulness, ease of use) to consider when designing online learning.
Using cognitive mapping techniques, learners can simulate and analyze key causal relationships in online learning design.
Based on the Technology Acceptance Model (TAM), learners can establish online learning implementation strategies and improve them through team feedback.
Learners can revise and improve their online learning design prototype at least twice based on formative assessment results.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
